Module org.monarchinitiative.phenol.core
Package org.monarchinitiative.phenol.ontology.algo

Class OntologyAlgorithm

java.lang.Object
org.monarchinitiative.phenol.ontology.algo.OntologyAlgorithm
public class OntologyAlgorithm extends Object
Implementation of several commonly needed algorithms for traversing and searching in and Ontology.
Author:
Peter Robinson, HyeongSik Kim

    • getChildTerms

      @Deprecated(forRemoval=true, since="2.0.2") public static Set<TermId> getChildTerms(Ontology ontology, TermId parentTermId)
      Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
      get OntologyGraph by calling MinimalOntology.graph() and use OntologyGraph.getChildrenStream(Object, boolean) instead, setting includeSource=true. The method will be removed in 3.0.0.
      Find all of the direct children of parentTermId. Include parentTermId itself in the returned set.
      Parameters:
      ontology - The ontology to which parentTermId belongs
      parentTermId - The term whose children were are seeking
      Returns:
      A set of all child terms of parentTermId (including parentTermId itself)

    • getChildTerms

      @Deprecated(forRemoval=true, since="2.0.2") public static Set<TermId> getChildTerms(MinimalOntology ontology, TermId parentTermId, boolean includeOriginalTerm)
      Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
      get OntologyGraph by calling MinimalOntology.graph() and use OntologyGraph.getChildrenStream(Object, boolean) instead. The method will be removed in 3.0.0.
      Find all the direct children of parentTermId (do not include "grandchildren" and other descendents).
      Parameters:
      ontology - The ontology to which parentTermId belongs
      parentTermId - The term whose children were are seeking
      includeOriginalTerm - true if we should include the term itself in the set of returned child terms
      Returns:
      A set of all child terms of parentTermId

      get OntologyGraph by calling MinimalOntology.graph(), use OntologyGraph.getChildrenStream(Object, boolean) for each parent term and concatenate the streams. The method will be removed in 3.0.0.

      Parameters:
      ontology - The ontology to which the set of parentTermIds belong
      parentTermIdSet - The terms whose children were are seeking
      Returns:
      set of children of parentTermIdSet

      Parameters:
      ontology - The ontology to which parentTermId belongs
      parentTermId - The term whose descendents were are seeking

    • getParentTerms

      @Deprecated(forRemoval=true, since="2.0.2") public static Set<TermId> getParentTerms(Ontology ontology, TermId childTermId)
      Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
      get OntologyGraph by calling MinimalOntology.graph() and use OntologyGraph.getParentsStream(Object, boolean), setting includeSource=true. The method will be removed in 3.0.0.
      Find all of the direct parents of childTermId (do not include "grandchildren" and other descendents).
      Parameters:
      ontology - The ontology to which parentTermId belongs
      childTermId - The term whose parents were are seeking
      Returns:
      A set of all parent terms of childTermId including childTermId itself

    • getAncestorTerms

      @Deprecated(forRemoval=true, since="2.0.2") public static Set<TermId> getAncestorTerms(Ontology ontology, TermId childTermId)
      Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
      get OntologyGraph by calling MinimalOntology.graph() and use OntologyGraph.getAncestors(Object, boolean), setting includeSource=true. The method will be removed in 3.0.0.
      Find all the ancestor terms of childTermId, including parents and so on up to the root. This is a wrapper around the function Ontology.getAncestorTermIds(TermId) for convenience - it is the counterpart of getDescendents(Ontology, TermId)
      Parameters:
      ontology - The ontology to which childTermId belongs
      childTermId - The term whose ancestors were are seeking
      Returns:
      A set of all ancestors of childTermId

      Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
      get OntologyGraph by calling MinimalOntology.graph() and use OntologyGraph.nodesAreSiblings(Object, Object). The method will be removed in 3.0.0.

    • termsAreRelated

      public static boolean termsAreRelated(Ontology ontology, TermId t1, TermId t2)
      Parameters:
      ontology - An ontology
      t1 - One Ontology term
      t2 - Another ontology term
      Returns:
      true iff t1 and t2 have a common ancestor that is not the root of the ontology
